subject: Art & Design
title: Montage: Editing as Storytelling
description: A quick, practical guide to Montage: Editing as Storytelling.

hook.text: Rocky punches meat, runs stairs, does push-ups ‚Äî all in 60 seconds. That's a training montage.

buildup.text: Montage compresses time by cutting together a series of shots to show progression or parallel events.

discovery.text: Soviet filmmaker Eisenstein proved that the meaning of a shot changes based on what shot follows it.

twist.text: Show a face, then food: the man looks hungry. Same face, then a coffin: he looks sad. Same face, different story.

climax.text: The Kuleshov Effect proved that audiences create meaning from juxtaposition, not just from images alone.

punchline.text: Cinema isn't in the shots. It's in the cuts between them.

quiz.question: What does the Kuleshov Effect demonstrate?
options: Audiences create meaning from the juxtaposition of shots
